item.title: Today’s Strands #726 Hints and Answers for February 27, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Strands is a daily word search puzzle game from The New York Times. It is a relatively new game, launched in 2024, in which players seek a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid.

Whether it’s your first time playing or you’re a Strands veteran, today’s tips and strategies can help you find words faster. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Strands, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answers for Strands Game #726 for Friday, February 27, 2026

To play today’s Strands, head to the game’s website.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s edition of Strands. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Strands

Strands is a daily word search that challenges you to find words with a common theme. There’s also a Spanagram that reveals the deeper theme behind the words.

  • Words that are three letters and under do not count.
  • Words that reveal the correct theme appear in blue.
  • The Spanagram turns yellow when found.
  • Finding three words that don’t fit the theme will reveal a hint to help you find the proper words.

The goal is to string together as many words as possible. Every letter on the grid gets used! Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Strands can only be played on the New York Times website or on the NYT Games app.

Strands Hints For Today, February 27, 2026

The Strands’ answers for Game #726 are all about overabundance. Therefore, you have to think of words that you might use to describe when you’ve had too much of something.

General Strands Hints For February 27

Without giving today’s Strands answers completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is the name of the 17th DLC pack for PAYDAY 2.
  • Hint 2: One of the seven deadly sins, which means to overeat or overindulge, is derived from this four-letter word that is rarely used on its own.
  • Hint 3: The spanagram is a two-word phrase that you might use when you have had enough of hearing someone talk about a certain subject.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Strands #726 for February 27, 2026.

Words to Help You Find Strand Hints for February 27, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Strands answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you unlock some in-game hints. A few starter words that may help are:

  • NUDE
  • PRAT
  • RELY
  • RONE
  • READY

Today’s Strands Answer For Game #726 On February 27, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answers to today’s Strands below. Check out the answers for yesterday’s puzzle here.

  • OVERKILL
  • EXCESS
  • GLUT
  • REDUNDANCY
  • SURPLUS
  • SPANAGRAM: ENOUGHALREADY

If you solved today’s Strands without our answers, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

When Is The Next Strands Game After #726?

All New York Times games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours leading up to it, giving players a heads-up. The game on February 28 will be Strands Game #727.

What Is Strands?

Strands is a daily word search puzzle game created by The New York Times. Launched in 2024, Strands challenges players to discover a common theme among words in a 6×8 letter grid. The game’s original concept was developed by Juliette Seive, a research director on The New York Times Games team, with the aim of replicating Wordle’s success. Tracy Bennett serves as the puzzle editor for Strands, overseeing the creation and curation of daily puzzles since its launch.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: MLB The Show 26 Adds New Trade Hub to Franchise Mode
item.content:encoded:
Sony San Diego has shared an update on upcoming content for MLB The Show 26‘s Franchise Mode.

This year, Sony is touting more control than ever for players looking to be the GM of their favorite team. New updates included a new Trade Hub with overhauled logic, smarter AI GMs, and more.

It’s All About the Tricks of the Trade in MLB The Show 26

This year, Sony San Diego is heavily promoting the brand new Trade Hub, which they’re calling a one-stop shop for all the deals players will make as Franchise general managers. The logic across all trades has been updated. Players will have access to a more complex system that takes into account several factors, including season standings, market size, rivalries, and more. They’ve also incorporated secondary positions into roster decisions. The hope is that this will lead to the most realistic GM experience yet.

Sony San Diego is also touting updates to the Lineup and Rotation Logic, making it more in line with current MLB lineup trends. There’s also an added trade slot, which means players can make up to 4 for 4 trades this year. Overall, this means more customization, more realism, and hopefully more enjoyment.

For more MLB The Show 26, check out the changes coming to this year’s career mode campaign, “Road to The Show.”

MLB The Show 26 is now available to pre-order in the Standard Edition and Digital Deluxe Edition. Those who pre-order the Deluxe Edition can play on March 13; the game releases to the general public on March 17.

There’s also a 10% discount on the Digital Deluxe Edition.

Are you excited for MLB The Show 26? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
